intro: Cambessedesia gracilis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture with prominent veins.
